eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: Blaze is invited to the Ning Manor, where Xingzhu confesses to being a daughter of the Nings, and to having met Blaze's father before. Elsewhere, Jie Zhen finds Leizi, and hints to Leizi that she should stay staunch and see the investigation through to the end.

attributes.content: You came.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Of course I did. That's what you do when the Nings invite you.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry, I didn't mean to hide anything from you. I just... don't really think it's something I should bring up for no reason...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Nothing to apologize for. You've got your troubles. I'm not the kind to give you the stink eye just for being blue-blooded.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Sooo, what do I call you, lady of House Ning?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: My name is... Ning Yin.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I'm... not actually part of House Ning. I was adopted by Grandfather as a child.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: He always introduced me as a distant relative of the Nings, but I've never met any 'relative' who actually shares blood with me.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Do you remember what I told you before?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Look, I'm pretty bad at comforting people...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No, it's okay. Grandfather's very nice to me, and my background has never caused me any trouble at all... everyone treats me very well.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Your grandpa would be... Ning Shu? Ex-Minister of Rites?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Perfect, Iâ€”
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I know... I know.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: It's getting chilly. Don't just stand out there, let's go inside and talk. Okay?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Sure, I guess.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The corridor meanders on, through a rock garden and a bamboo thicket, then between the two halves of a lotus pond.

A cool breeze brushes through; the autumn waters softly ripple, and in them Blaze's reflection follows behind Ning Yin's as they pace across the bridge. The two pass through a deserted room, packed-up belongings and dead leaves strewn everywhere.
The courtyard is messy, I know. Not presentable to guests, at the very least. I apologize.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: The whole family's moving out of here soon. Grandfather can't take Baizao's dry climate in his old age. We're planning to move back to the old place in Jiangnan.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Though Ning Yin's pace is glacial, she can only hurry up once she notices her friend in no mood to appreciate the scenery.
Up ahead. We're almost there.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Take a seat. I'll fetch some tea and refreshments from the kitchen. Our house cooks are all on leave, so I can't serve you much more than some cold sidesâ€”
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: No need to bother. I can't stick around long.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: ...Are things that urgent?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Well, alright...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Ning softly closes the door. The chirps of fowl outside fade. The room grows heavier with silence.
Alright. Tell me why you invited me here.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I was going to look for you yesterday, actually, after the fire at Ding Feng Lou.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: But I overheard your conversation with the Deputy Minister of Judicial Review Office and Chef Mo...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Blaze, I... might have met your father before.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: When I was fifteen years old, I remember we had a visitor.
Grandfather was always busy with work. His apprentices and coworkers were coming and going in the estate. None of my business, by and large.
But slowly, I realized an extra person had moved in, wearing blue low-ranking mandarin's robes. Every time I saw him, he was alone, as if other people just weren't his concern.
At first, I didn't really pay attention. It was later that year, on my birthday, when...
Like every other year, Grandfather would hold this great big birthday dinner for me.
With lights and banners strung up everywhere, and friends and family all around... not that I knew more than a handful of them.
They were chatting the day away, and about what, I had no clue. So eventually I sneaked out of the dinner, and nobody noticed when I did.
I wandered around the courtyard for ages, bored out of my mind, then scampered into Grandfather's study on a whim.
It was in there where I saw the man again.
I remember I saw him stuffing his pocket with letter papers and brushes. When he noticed me, his face was stretched with nervousness, and he pulled the brush and paper back out again in a rush.
Are you...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: It's not what it looks like!
attributes.name: Agitated Man

attributes.content: I... needed to finish copying some letters, so I was going to take them home. The High Minister is sending these to very important mandarins, so I was just worried if the paper wasn't good enough...
attributes.name: Agitated Man

attributes.content: I just...
attributes.name: Agitated Man

attributes.content: It's okay, it's just brushes and paper. You're welcome to make use of it, Sir.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Thank you, little lady.
attributes.name: Agitated Man

attributes.content: Um, what's your name...?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: My name is... Gu Quan. I'm a transcriber for your estate. I copy and file the estate correspondence.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I'm Ning Yin...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Miss Ning... Of course, I know you.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Then now we know each other.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Sir, I want to read in here for a bit. I won't interrupt you while you work. Is that okay?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Oâ€”Of course...! Feel free, Miss Ning.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Miss Ning... are you into these history books?
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Mm-hm. Grandfather always says one should view history as a mirror. We must use it to study our ancestors' wisdom and character, and learn from their teachings.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: But I think reading's just fun. It's like all these amazing people recorded in the texts are coming to life before me, and they're all my friends.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I think someday, it might be nice to join the Imperial Historical Cabinet as a historian myself.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: You've got quite a unique outlook, Miss Ning...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: If you're interested in following in the High Minister's family footsteps, I'm sure you'd do well.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: You think Grandfather's really cool too, then?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: ...Of course. Minister Ning's been helming the Ministry of Rites for decades. He has plenty of deeds to his name. He's the mandarin everyone loves.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Mm-hm... everyone in this family is so cool.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: My uncle and aunt are always away from Baizao, traveling all over the country. I hear Yan couldn't have set up the meteorological and earthquake systems it has today without them.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: And Ciqiu, my little sister, she's even cooler.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: She's two years younger than me, but at the last Baizao Academy study camp, all the professors from the college of foreign affairs were praising her! Everyone was teasing her by calling her 'Little Miss Minister'!
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: All the people in my family are going to leave their names in the history books.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I love them and respect them a lot. I want to record who they are, and everything they do... but I could never become like them.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Compared to them, I'm just... normal.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: You know, that reminds me of something my master once said to me.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: 'As history has ebbed and flowed, the floods and tides are recorded, yet most are streams that simply trickle on by... But without the babbling brook, how would the waves arise?'
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: The waves and brooks don't care about who's greater, or who's plainer...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Indeed, the vast majority will never get to leave their names in the history annals, but they're not the empty space between the lines. They're the pages themselves.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I talked your ear off there...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Sir, your handwriting is really beautiful.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Oh, well, this... it's my only skill, really. I can still remember when the High Minister gave me this transcriber job.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I can never write my name properly. Grandfather's gotten on my case about it more times than I can remember.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Handwriting is a long road. Just keep at it, and you'll see change eventually.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Maybe you could be my calligraphy teacher, then?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I would never pose as your teacher with my modest brushwork, Miss. But...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Right... I have two copybooks here. I copy from them all the time myself. The forms are very regularâ€”it's perfect for beginners.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: If you don't mind, Miss Ning, you can... you can have these as your birthday present.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: How did you know my birthday's today?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Well, they decorate the estate so brightly this time every year, you see. I've spent long enough here that I've heard.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Miss Ning... Happy birthday.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Thâ€”Thank you.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: That conversation always stayed with me. I liked how he talked, and how he saw things.
And I don't know whyâ€”I can't really sayâ€”but he felt so close to me, in a way.
But after that, I saw him much less around the estate. The next time I got to talk to him, it was years and years later.

Grandfather's cold has lasted for a month by now, and it's still not getting any better. Now it's almost winterâ€”it might only get worse at this rate. We'll be counting on you for the next while, doctor.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: The High Minister's malady is mostly from overwork. You could remind him to rest more often, my lady...
attributes.name: Ning's Physician
Ning Yin
attributes.content: Mm-hm, I willâ€”

attributes.name: Ning Yin
attributes.content: Ah.
Sorry! I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: I apologize for running into you, Miss.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *cough* *hack*â€”Very... very sorry...
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: It'sâ€”it's alright! Sir... are you okay?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Why don't you sit down and rest for a while? You really look... quite ill.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I'm fine... I'm fine.
attributes.name: Gu Quan

attributes.content: Sir, you dropped yourâ€”sir?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Are these... painkillers?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: *hiss*... Strong painkillers at that... Whoever that was, he must be quite badly ill.
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: Doctor, if you're free, could I ask you to attend to that man too? You can bill his medical expenses to me.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I was worried about Grandfather's condition at the time, and didn't pay that encounter much mindâ€”I was just planning to pay him a visit later at some point, when I had the time.
But after that winter, I never saw him again.
Doctor, thank you so much for all your work. Grandfather's back in perfect health now.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Right. And about the man I asked you to attend to...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Oh, you mean that Gu Quan man.
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: He died.
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: Was it his illness...?
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: No... I hear some kind of accident took him while he was on his way to Victoria.
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: But given his health, I can't imagine he'd have lived much longer even then...
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: Truth is, last I met him, his malady had taken root in his vitalsâ€”I could hear it in his breathing. I can't imagine how much he was suffering in life...
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: And it's a mystery to me why he'd decide to travel so far while that sick...
attributes.name: Ning's Physician

attributes.content: This... very room. It was the study Sir Gu Quan was using.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: It's been ten years since he passed away. The place has gone through some changes in that time.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: This...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I couldn't tell you why... but I kept hold of this medicine bottle ever since.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Blaze... I really am so sorry...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: He wasâ€”my dad was nothing like that...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I don't think he was ever that fighting fit, but he was never weak. Whenever I was with him, he always had this light in his eyesâ€”
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: How could...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Even now, I'm not sure I understand Sir Gu Quan... but I know he was a warm, gentle person. I could tell.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I blamed myself over and over, for not being able to do anything more for him...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Why are you bothering to... tell me all this...?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I know you suspect that my grandfather was somehow behind your father's passing. At the point, I can only tell you what I know, butâ€”
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: You told me all of this just to try and convince me Ning Shu is INNOCENT?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Nâ€”No.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: I just wanted to implore you... please, find out the truth.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Whether for Sir Gu Quan's sake... or for the sake of the truth itself.
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Whatever that truthâ€”even is...
attributes.name: Ning Yin

attributes.content: Are you...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You don't have to tell me twice... I am gonna get to the bottom of this.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What first struck Lin Qingyan about the Judicial Review Office was the solemn hush.
The first time she ever set foot through this courtroom's door, all noise promptly vanished behind her. She remembers Yu Cheng telling her why it was designed so.
Silence begets peace, peace begets thought, thought begets results.
Shouldn't the Judicial Review Office be drowning in work top to bottom? And yet you've got the office all to yourself, Deputy Minister Lin?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Jie Zhen...? What are you here for?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Censorate routine investigation. There are some issues we'd like to consult you on regarding the Yu Cheng case.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Consultation or investigation, which is it?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Deputy Minister Lin, after working together for years, I implicitly trust you on a personal level.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: But the Department of Discipline and Supervision has a lot riding on this case. We have to go through the motions, Lin, if you'll pardon me.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Just... ask what you need to.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Name.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Gender.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: ...Female.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Um... let's skip the basic info for now. For the next few questions, you don't need to elaborate on your answers, just respond 'yes' or 'no'.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Are you grilling me?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Everything you say from hereon will be recorded. I'm worried what you say could fly against you.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: If you have no further questions, let's begin.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Deputy Minister Lin, you passed Tianshi Bureau assessments in childhood and were exceptionally admitted per your outstanding grades, and followed the esteemed Cyanstorm Count in learning your Lei Fa.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: After graduating from the Tianshi Bureaus, you chose to join the Judicial Review Office, and soon accompanied then-Deputy Minister Yu Cheng in investigations all across the realm.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: In just a year, from Registrar, you rose several ranks to become the youngest Deputy Minister in the history of Yan.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Is this background, as stated, true?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: In your third month with the Judicial Review Office, as Registrar, you handed in a whistleblower report to Discipline and Supervision. It accused the Right Assistant Revenue Minister of embezzlement and extortion, and you recovered ten million in stolen assets.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: In your fifth month, in Changji, you essentially singlehandedly shone light on the local academy's examination fraud. Over a hundred mandarins were implicated in this, the highest of which was second-rank, all were eventually rounded up.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Upon becoming Deputy Minister, you handled the case of former Judicial Review Office Deputy Minister Yu Cheng forging evidence, causing him to be expelled from the Office's Haoran Pavilion, with all status stripped from him thereafter...
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Are these case histories, as stated, true?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: With an academic background like this, surely everyone lauds you as a young up-and-comer blessed to the gills with talent.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: And yet people can't help but wonderâ€”what gives such a greenhand mandarin the courage, the capacity to handle these cases?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Can you get to the point?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: If I'm remembering right, your good mother and father were Tianshis at the Chamber of Heaven's Designs, spending years building much in the north, even being vested personally by the True Lung.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The Lin family's a well-bred one, many Tianshi giants in its line. And on top of that, rumor has it they're quite closely-knit with the Lord Exorcist's household.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: As for Cyanstorm Count... I think even the rank fails to sufficiently capture your shifu's importance to Great Yan.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: ...Are these relationships, as stated, true?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Jie Zhen, what are you doing?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You need only answer 'yes' or 'no', Deputy Minister Lin.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Don't think I'm deaf to your connotations... You're trying to say, it was only by leaning on my background that I could take on Judicial cases all these years?!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: ...I certainly didn't say that at any point.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Having known each other for years, I would never doubt your integrity. The Lin Qingyan in my mind's eye has always been a pursuer of justice.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: But why, Lin, do you not pursue now?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Jie Zhen... Just why did you come to see me today?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: How much do you really know about the Yu Cheng affair?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: As I just said, I'm here to see you today on routine business.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: As for the Yu Cheng case, what I heard in the courtroom that day is all I know.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: What makes you so dead-set on the case, Censor Jie Zhen?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Before you decided you'd investigate it, I remember we actually had an argument.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I'm going to speak out of line here... the whole stripping of his rank aside, I really do respect people like Yu Cheng.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Now of all times, you're going to defend him again?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: If a law enforcer does not themselves abide by the law, that's abuse of power. That goes for every last member of the Three Organs of Justiceâ€”what kind of double-standard could you possibly be applying here?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: No, no... The Judicial Review Office's verdict is settled on Yu Cheng's mistake. I've little more to say there.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I'm just very curious... What kind of truth could have pushed him to such means to find it?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: You must be more familiar with Yu Cheng than me.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: In your opinion, was he a smart man?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Naturally. When it comes to sniffing out lies or chasing down leads, I'm no match for him.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Then did you ever wonder if, supposing Yu Cheng truly intended to cover up his own forgery, you should have been able to make such short work of the case?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: You're telling me he let me find him out on purpose? What for?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: That, I don't know. But he put you in charge of the scrollery fire case... To an outsider, I don't think I can say that Yu Cheng had no faith in you.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: You've been all over Baizao the past few days investigating that case, I know that. I've heard as much.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: And yet since yesterday, you've been loitering in the Judicial Review Office, acting like you've been grounded.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I can't help being curiousâ€”what made you go and give up on pursuing this case?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Are you afraid of offending the high and mighty? No, that's not like the Lin Qingyan I know...
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Did someone lofty crack down on you? Can't be, I think. You're sitting here in the office, after all, not in a Judicial prison cell.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: If not that, then all my pondering can only produce one answer...
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: You're scared that if you continue, you'll implicate someone you know.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Seems I guessed right.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: In the thick of things, your concern clouds your judgment. It's like you've forgotten the simplest of truths.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Don't miss the forest for the trees.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: If you can't hide it, you may as well tip it out. Show it some sunlight.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Mr. Censor, you've really served up a lesson for me today.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Not at all. I think the hush of this office must've helped you figure out plenty by yourself.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I know what I must do.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Madam, I went to ask Deputy Minister Lin if she wanted anything to eat, since I saw she hadn't left the office all day, butâ€”but she...
attributes.name: Worried Official

attributes.content: When did she go missing?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Iâ€”I don't know, nobody's seen her at all...
attributes.name: Worried Official

attributes.content: A biting chill gusts through, the stiff breeze curling papers and sending them dancing madly through the air.
A wide-open window clatters against its wall. On the table beneath it, a ceremonial gown lies neatly folded and topped with a document, pressed down in place by an ink stone.
It is Lin Qingyan's written resignation.
Watching as Blaze vanishes far into the distance, Ning Shu clutches the door knocker.
The vague dark point vanishes over the crest of the path, but her stare remains fixed there, lingering for the longest time.
What are you spacing out at the door for?
attributes.name: Ning Shu

attributes.content: Grandfather...
attributes.name: Ning Yin
